p:
Dispersal of organisms consists of several different processes, e.g., processes mediated by species’ inherent dispersal ability and human transfer, and those processes may have different shapes of their dispersal kernels. Among invasive species often human activities mediate their dispersal that allow rapid range expansions
12 . Moreover, meta-analyses suggest humans as the major vector spreading invasive species
5, 13 . Distances of human traveling often show power-law distribution
9, 10 ; therefore, this human-mediated dispersal can give an ability of long-distance dispersal to invader species, which may otherwise spread slowly by their limited inherent dispersal abilities. Therefore, invasive species’ range expansion is better modeled as a stratified dispersal that considers more than one processes is involved in the spread of the invasive species
12 .
